basics.name: Supratik "Neil" Baksi
basics.label: Bachelors of Engineering (Honours)(Software) Graduate from UNSW
basics.summary:
I am a dynamic Front-End Developer with a strong foundation in Full-Stack development, specialising in Web Development and UI/UX Design. I excel at crafting intuitive, high-performance digital experiences by leveraging cutting-edge technologies and innovative solutions.

I am an MBA candidate at Melbourne Business School.

I also freelance as a Shopify and Javascript Developer, where I apply my expertise to build seamless, user-centric e-commerce platforms.

My passion lies in bridging the gap between design and technology, consistently delivering impactful solutions that enhance user engagement and drive business success.

highlights: Developed reusable components for projects throughmodular programming techniques.
Collaborated with back-end developers to integrate APIs intofront-end designs.
Ensured maximum compatibility with various browsers through extensive QA testing methods.
Created automated build processes to streamline the deployment process of web applications.
Designed and implemented responsive layouts for all devices.
Monitored page speed performance metrics through Google Analytics and PageSpeed Insights.
Managed multiple projects simultaneously while adhering to established deadlines.
Utilized version control systems such as Git to manage project changes.
Liaised with internal teams to collect and analyze product requirements.
Performed and directed Web site updates.
Debugged cross-browser compatibility issues in IE, Chrome, Firefox and Safari.
Troubleshot coding errors utilizing browser debugging tools such as Firebug or Chrome DevTools.

Assist with the development and integration of Limepay‚Äôs core product STACK ‚Äì an embeddable all in one payments solution integrated with international payment processors under the hood in React-Typescript/Redux with React-Hooks while working in an Agile -SCRUM system and Domain-Driven-Design.

Develop reusable and scalable React components to be used across Limepay‚Äôs offerings ‚Äì In-store checkout, customer/merchant and internal dashboards, etc; in React-Typescript/Redux. with React-Hooks
Assist in the development and maintenance of the Limepay Design System ‚Äì Cosmic; in React- Typescript/Redux with React-Hooks.

Responsible for the development of Limepay-Domain (https://www.domain.com.au/) joint venture - MarketNow in React-TS/Redux with React-Hooks and miscellaneous other tasks relating to marketing - websites and emails; all in a Specification by Example development process.
Assist in maintaining the Limepay website and linked marketing pages in Gatsby.js with Netlify
Converted and developed the Limepay Customer, Merchant, and Admin dashboards for the Limepay core BNPL product from PUG(Node.js) to React-TS/Redux.
Assist in UI/UX development by closely working with UI/UX Designer in Figma and Miro.
Maintain unit tests using JEST, Enzyme and E2E tests using Cypress.
Maintain company email templates in BeePro and Amazon SES.
Assist in the designing, creation and development of EnterOffer website and features using ReactJS and other front end technologies, and integrated with Firebase Database, Storage and hosted over AWS
Exposed to eCommerce website builders like Shopify, Wix, BigCommerce

work.summary: Developed an Application Compliance Monitoring Dashboard for pre-production and production servers

Effectively generated reports and data visualisation using Microsoft PowerBI
Gained valuable knowledge on Level 3 Application support
Worked efficiently with managing offshore clients, taking calls, queue management, picking up tickets on HP Service Manager and handling tickers of varying severity

Held similar positions at Alseasons Hospitality, The Star Entertainment Group, Benchmarque
